Detailed Description

AtlItemBox handles items of type IndicatorItem in a special way: The box is only part of its parent control, if the feature of the value item is available. If the value of the value item changes, text and icon to be displayed are updated.

Item *  item
) 
 

Parameters:
control Parent control where the item box is embedded. Usually the parent control is an instance of the class Window.
item Item which should be displayed. Changing the properties of this item automatically leads to a redrawing of the item box.

Reimplemented from ItemBox.

void AtlItemBox::OnFeatureChanged (  Feature *  changed_feature,
INT  property_id
)  [protected, virtual]
 

If the property becomes available, the item box is added to its parent control. If it becomes unavailable, the item box is removed from its parent control. Instead of it, a feature listener is added as dispatcher to the active application. This way, the feature listener is able to add the item box back to the parent control, when the value item's property becomes available, again. In case the property is available, text and icon of the value item must be updated, because the property value has changed.

BOOLEAN AtlItemBox::OnMessage (  const Message &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Handles FeatureChangedMsg in order to react on state and value changes of the value item's property.

Reimplemented from ItemBox.
